summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding investigative leads on St. Thomas. The emails discuss following up on media reports that airport workers saw Jeffrey Epstein traveling with what they believed were minor girls, with the goal of identifying those workers for interviews and potential search warrant development.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; airport workers reportedly saw him flying into St. Thomas with girls they believed were minors.

events.title: Email coordination on St. Thomas airport worker leads
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney emails colleagues about following up on media reports of St. Thomas airport workers who claim to have seen Jeffrey Epstein traveling with minors, suggesting interviews and potential search warrant relevance.

keyFacts: Multiple workers at the airstrip on St. Thomas were quoted in recent articles saying they repeatedly saw Jeffrey Epstein fly in with girls they believed were minors.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively coordinating to identify and interview those anonymous airport workers.
The information was considered relevant not only for the current case but also in connection with a potential search warrant on St. Thomas.
The correspondence shows investigative follow-up on media reports as part of the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
